text: The prime minister of Norway (, literally the "minister of the state") is the head of the government of Norway and the most powerful person in Norwegian politics. The prime minister and Cabinet is almost always the leader of the majority party in the Storting, or the leader of the senior partner in the governing coalition. Norway has a Constitution, which was adopted on 17 May 1814. The position of prime minister is the result of legislation. The current prime minister of Norway is Jonas Gahr Støre, of the Labour Party since October 2021. ==Living former prime ministers== File:Gro Harlem Brundtland 2009.jpg|Gro Harlem Brundtland born served 1981, 1986–1989 and 1990–1996 File:KjellMagneBondevik (edit).JPG|Kjell Magne Bondevik born served 1997–2000 and 2001–2005 File:Thorbjørn Jagland par Claude Truong-Ngoc novembre 2013.jpg|Thorbjørn Jagland born served 1996–1997 File:Jens Stoltenberg MSC 2017 (cropped).png|Jens Stoltenberg born served 2000–2001 and 2005–2013 File:Wil Lee-Wright foto Rein Traante2017 MG 0419 (32592903182).jpg|Erna Solberg born served 2013–2021 ==References== ==Other websites== *Government Official Homepage
title: Prime Minister of Norway
